decks.notes: This Grixis Aggro deck focuses on using cheap and efficient spells to disrupt the opponent's game plan while maintaining pressure with fast threats like Delver of Secrets and Dragon's Rage Channeler. The deck aims to control the board by countering key spells with Force of Will and Daze, while also utilizing disruptive lands like Wasteland. Murktide Regent provides a powerful finisher, and cards like Mishra's Bauble and Ponder help ensure consistent draws. Overall, the key concept of this deck is to be proactive, aggressive, and disruptive in order to win quickly.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize fast mana sources like Ancient Tomb and Lotus Petal to quickly ramp into powerful Eldrazi creatures such as Thought-Knot Seer and Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Chalice of the Void and Noxious Revival while applying pressure with aggressive Eldrazi creatures. By utilizing the synergy between Eldrazi Temple and Eye of Ugin, this deck can overwhelm opponents with large threats early in the game and close out matches quickly with a combination of disruption and aggression.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly ramp up mana using Cloudpost and other lands to play big threats like Emrakul and Ulamog. Utilizing cards like Crop Rotation and Once Upon a Time to find key pieces and Disruptor Flute to disrupt opponents' strategies, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures and control elements. The synergy between cards like The One Ring and Sowing Mycospawn allow for explosive plays, while Karn, the Great Creator provides additional utility and disruption. This deck aims to quickly establish a dominant board presence and win the game through powerful combos and efficient ramp.

The main objective of this deck is to quickly fill your graveyard with powerful creatures like Grief and Troll of Khazad-dûm using cards like Entomb and Reanimate. By utilizing the combo aspect of the deck, you can bring these creatures back onto the battlefield for a low cost, overwhelming your opponent with powerful threats. Additionally, the deck has control elements like Force of Will and Daze to protect your combo pieces and disrupt your opponent's strategy. The use of card draw spells like Brainstorm and Ponder helps to find the necessary combo pieces quickly.

The main strategy of this deck is to quickly assemble the combo of Dark Depths and Thespian's Stage to create a 20/20 Marit Lage token. The deck includes cards to search for and protect the combo pieces, as well as disruption and removal spells to control the game until the combo can be assembled. Additionally, the deck includes mana acceleration and fixing to ensure the combo can be achieved as early as possible. The focus is on efficiently executing the combo while disrupting the opponent's game plan.

The focus of this deck is to quickly disrupt and overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures, backed up by disruption spells to control the game. By utilizing powerful creatures like Troll of Khazad-dûm and Grief, along with control elements such as Force of Will and Daze, the deck aims to apply pressure early while hindering the opponent's game plan. Reanimate and Brazen Borrower provide additional versatility and threats, while the deck's mana base ensures consistency in casting spells and controlling the board.

The deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with powerful creatures using cards like Entomb and Animate Dead, then bringing them back into play with Reanimate. It also utilizes counterspells like Force of Will and Daze to protect its combo pieces. The deck includes disruptive elements like Wasteland to control the opponent's mana base and creatures like Brazen Borrower for additional control. The archetype's goal is to reanimate high-impact creatures like Archon of Cruelty to overwhelm the opponent and secure a quick victory.

The main focus of this Legacy Dimir Tempo deck is to disrupt and control the opponent's game plan while quickly deploying threats to pressure them. Using a mix of disruption spells like Daze, Force of Will, and Fatal Push, along with efficient creatures like Delver of Secrets and Troll of Khazad-dûm, the deck aims to create a tempo advantage by keeping the opponent on the back foot. By combining disruption with aggressive threats, the deck can quickly close out games before the opponent can stabilize.

The main idea of this deck is to quickly assemble the combo of Cephalid Illusionist and Nomads en-Kor to mill your entire library and win the game with either Thassa's Oracle or Dread Return. The deck runs protection in the form of Force of Will and Swords to Plowshares, while also utilizing cards like Ponder and Brainstorm to find key pieces of the combo. Urza's Saga can help tutor for crucial pieces, making the deck consistent and quickly assembling its win condition. The key strategy is to combo off as quickly as possible while disrupting the opponent's game plan.

The deck focuses on assembling the Doomsday combo quickly and efficiently to win the game by either casting Thassa's Oracle or using The One Ring. The deck includes various fast mana sources, disruption spells like Force of Will and Daze, and cantrips like Ponder and Brainstorm to set up the combo. The main goal is to manipulate the top of the library with Doomsday, stack the deck to win, and protect the combo with counterspells. The deck also includes some unusual cards like Orcish Bowmasters and Vexing Bauble for added synergy.

The deck revolves around using Doomsday to set up a winning combination of cards, typically involving Thassa's Oracle or other key pieces like Lion's Eye Diamond. The deck includes cards that enable fast mana generation such as Dark Ritual, Lotus Petal, and Cabal Ritual, as well as protection through Force of Will and Daze. The deck also includes card selection tools like Brainstorm and Ponder to help find and set up the combo. The sideboard likely includes additional disruption and protection options to help against different matchups.
